citations.narrative:
* In the main kennel, the end enclosure, to the right of the front door, has an opening in the side wall where the one adult
dog chewed and scratched through the wall. The opening is approximately two inches wide and has insulation that the
dog is pulling out of it. This indicates the kennel facilities are not being maintained and kept in good repair on a regular
basis. As a result, injury could be caused from the dog ingesting the insulation and the other chewed materials and
excessively scratch surface cannot be properly cleaned and sanitized.
For the protection from injury and to keep the housing facilities in good repair and for required cleaning and sanitation, all
surfaces for the dogs must be maintained on a regular basis.
To be corrected by, 26-September-2025.

* The outside portion of the enclosures for the (Whelping Building) have an accumulation of fecal waste pressed into the
openings of the plastic flooring. The fecal waste appeared dry and was brownish green to grayish white in color. This
indicates the surfaces have not been spot-cleaned daily or sanitized. A metal dog door and the area around the door have
an accumulation of brown grime on the surface.
The inside portion of the enclosures for the (Whelping Building) have wood chips and soiled wet shredded paper with
fecal waste. In areas, the fecal waste and wet, soiled shredded paper is caked and or buildup onto the white plastic
flooring. This indicates that daily-spot cleaning and sanitization are not taking place.
The (Main Kennels) concrete flooring has an accumulation of fecal waste and yellow urine on its' surface. The fecal waste
was dry and green to gray in color. This indicates that daily spot-cleaning and sanitization are not taking place.
The Mentioned surfaces that are not being spot cleaned daily have an accumulation of waste and can attract insects and
pests and can increase the disease hazards for the 32 dogs and 27 puppies.
For the prevention of an accumulation of fecal waste, insects, pests and other disease hazards, all hard surfaces that
come into contact with dogs must be spot cleaned daily sanitized often.
To be corrected by, 26-September-2025.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
* The floor of the (Whelping Building) had an accumulation of pieces of paper, pieces of plastic, two large rolls of carpet,
Tornado fuel tube for a Tornado torch, grayish dust, numerous dead flies and shredded and or soiled shredded paper
scattered about on the concrete flooring. The shredded paper and or soiled shredder paper covered approximately 60 %
of the concrete floor.
The husbandry Table, with a brown bottle of medication ready for use, had numerous pieces of plastic and shredder
paper on top of its’ surface. The gray metal cabinet used to store husbandry products and medications has an
accumulation of gray dust and dead flies, webs and pieces of paper on top and the shelves. This indicates the inside of
the (Whelping Building) is not being kept clean of discarded matter, accumulations of trash and junk. As a result, if the
dogs get loose in this area they could be injured, and this area provides a living and breeding area for rodent’s other pests
and vermin.
The (Main Kennel) has an accumulation of sheered dog hair on the concrete. The stack plastic enclosures inside the
(Main Kennel) have an accumulation of grayish dust and kernels of dog food under neath it.
The grass and weeds around the (Whelping Building) and the (Main Kennel) are approximately ½ ‘ to 4’ tall. This indicates
the weeds and grass are not being controlled on a regular basis and can cause a rodent problem that affects the health
and well-being of the 32 adult dogs and 27 puppies.
For protection of the health and well-being of the dogs, all premises must be kept free of accumulations of trash, junk,
waste products, and discarded matter, and weeds, grasses, and bushes must be controlled so as to facilitate cleaning of
the premises and pest control.
To be corrected by, 26-September-2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

3.1(c)(2)

For the protection from injury and to keep the housing facilities in good repair and for required cleaning and sanitation, all 
surfaces for the dogs must be maintained on a regular basis.

* The outside portion of the enclosures for the (Whelping Building) have an accumulation of fecal waste pressed into the

The (Main Kennels) concrete flooring has an accumulation of fecal waste and yellow urine on its' surface. The fecal waste

The Mentioned surfaces that are not being spot cleaned daily have an accumulation of waste and can attract insects and

For the prevention of an accumulation of fecal waste, insects, pests and other disease hazards, all hard surfaces that 
come into contact with dogs must be spot cleaned daily sanitized often.

3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
* The floor of the (Whelping Building) had an accumulation of pieces of paper, pieces of plastic, two large rolls of carpet, 
Tornado fuel tube for a Tornado torch, grayish dust, numerous dead flies and shredded and or soiled shredded paper 
scattered about on the concrete flooring. The shredded paper and or soiled shredder paper covered approximately 60 % 
of the concrete floor.  
The husbandry Table, with a brown bottle of medication ready for use, had numerous pieces of plastic and shredder 
paper on top of its’ surface. The gray metal cabinet used to store husbandry products and medications has an 
accumulation of gray dust and dead flies, webs and pieces of paper on top and the shelves. This indicates the inside of 
the (Whelping Building) is not being kept clean of discarded matter, accumulations of trash and junk. As a result, if the 
dogs get loose in this area they could be injured, and this area provides a living and breeding area for rodent’s other pests 
and vermin.  
 
The (Main Kennel) has an accumulation of sheered dog hair on the concrete. The stack plastic enclosures inside the 
(Main Kennel) have an accumulation of grayish dust and kernels of dog food under neath it.  
 
The grass and weeds around the (Whelping Building) and the (Main Kennel) are approximately ½ ‘ to 4’ tall. This indicates 
the weeds and grass are not being controlled on a regular basis and can cause a rodent problem that affects the health 
and well-being of the 32 adult dogs and 27 puppies. 
 
For protection of the health and well-being of the dogs, all premises must be kept free of accumulations of trash, junk, 
waste products, and discarded matter, and weeds, grasses, and bushes must be controlled so as to facilitate cleaning of 
the premises and pest control. 
 
To be corrected by, 26-September-2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
